        • The instructions for how to play the role of Magnus Mulberrylane are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Magnus Mulberrylane. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Magnus Mulberrylane as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Magnus Mulberrylane would respond, and taking into account all information about Magnus Mulberrylane that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [02 Jul 1851 00:00:00] When Hazel Nutgrove was 6 years old, she watched with envy as a traveling peddler charmed the townsfolk with his tales and trinkets. Unlike the simple tools he displayed, Hazel saw the beauty she possessed and yearned to use it to captivate others. That day, she declared to her parents she would one day have the finest goods and the most captivating smile in the land.
          [02 Jul 1855 00:00:00] When Hazel Nutgrove was 9 years old, her family's fruit orchard was ravaged by a storm. While her parents lamented the loss, Hazel saw an opportunity. She reorganized the remaining, bruised apples, highlighting their unique imperfections, and successfully posed them as "artisanal." The townsfolk, who were used to plump, perfect fruit, fell prey to Hazel's artful storytelling, and she made a handsome profit from the storm's damage.
          [02 Jul 1863 00:00:00] When Hazel Nutgrove was 19 years old, she ventured outside her familiar county, setting up her fruit stall in a bustling city market. Dazzled by the endless array of silks and spices, she wasn't deterred by the sharp-eyed competition. Hazel observed, adapted, and inserted herself into the city's social circles, cultivating relationships within its elite, her peaches traded for gossip and access.
          [02 Jul 1865 00:00:00] When Hazel Nutgrove was 21 years old, her elaborate displays of fruit and her mesmerizing charm earned her the title of the "Queen of the Peaches" from a popular city newspaper. She savored the praise, the recognition, but it was the awe in people's eyes that truly fueled her.

          Statements:
          [25 Jul 1862 00:00:00] When Aiden Riversong was 16 years old, their father presented them with their own bags to carry at the market stall, hopeful for Aiden’s eventual contribution to the family business. Instead of accepting the bags with gratitude, Aiden let out a theatrical sigh and proclaimed they'd rather set off on an adventure filled with wealth and glory. This grand gesture, though born from a desire to avoid responsibility, ignited a yearning within Aiden for a life beyond the fruit stand, setting him on a path that he felt would be free from the burden of expectation.
          [25 Jul 1864 00:00:00] When Aiden Riversong was 19 years old, their father insisted they accompany him to buy fruit from a new supplier. Perdantly annoyed, Aiden convinced their father they could make more money traveling to the river market and selling the surplus mangoes themselves, painting a picture of boundless opportunity. The thought of undertaking such a grand adventure distracted Aiden from the practical worries of the trade route and convinced their father to agree.
          [25 Jul 1866 00:00:00] When Aiden Riversong was 21 years old, a visit to the marketplace sparked a fascination within Aiden. A colorful stall overflowing with exotic spices sent an intoxicating aroma into the air, drawing Aiden into a world of unknown delights. Distracted from the day's fruit trading, Aiden made an impulsive purchase of a sack of saffron destined for a wealthy merchant's kitchen. This unexpected acquisition sparked an insatiable curiosity, expanding Aiden's imagination beyond the realm of mundane fruit among other merchants. This marked the beginning of Aiden finding joy in fleeting experiences, distracting themselves from the recurring responsibility of their fruit business.

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Aiden Riversong wants to make as much money as possible.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aiden Riversong are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aiden Riversong. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aiden Riversong as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aiden Riversong would respond, and taking into account all information about Aiden Riversong that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aiden Riversong right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Aiden Riversong right now?
          Answer
          State

        • Aiden Riversong can make an offer to Magnus Mulberrylane.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aiden Riversong:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong -- "Two and a half is too steep, Magnus. I can get a better price in my hometown. How about two coins?"
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong is 52 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane -- "Two coins, Aiden? My peaches are the finest in Fruitville, practically bursting with juice. I can guarantee they'll be sold out by midday!"
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong -- "Alright, Magnus, two and a half it is. But these peaches better live up to your claims!"
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong and Magnus Mulberrylane agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Aiden Riversong stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Aiden Riversong is trying to buy some fruit from Hazel Nutgrove. They are negotiating a price. Aiden Riversong can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong "-- 3 coins for the bunch, fair price for such fine fruit."
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Now, Aiden, 3 coins is a bit low for this quality. 4, and I'll call it a day."
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong -- "3 coins is still a fair price, Hazel. Perhaps we can meet in the middle at 3 and a half?"
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Come now, Aiden, you know these berries are the best in the county. 4 coins is a fair offer for such quality."
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong and Hazel Nutgrove couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Aiden Riversong stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane -- "Five coins for the pair, Hazel. A fair price, wouldn't you say?"
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Four coins is my best price, Magnus. Take it or leave it."
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Aiden Riversong is trying to buy some fruit from Magnus Mulberrylane. They are negotiating a price. Aiden Riversong can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong -- "Mr. Mulberrylane, those melons look plump and juicy. How about I take a dozen for 5 coins?"
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane -- "Five coins apiece would be more reasonable, Mr. Riversong. These melons are exceptionally fine."
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Overarching goal: Aiden Riversong wants to make as much money as possible.

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Aiden Riversong


          Recalled memories and observations:

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong wants to make as much money as possible.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aiden Riversong are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aiden Riversong. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aiden Riversong as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aiden Riversong would respond, and taking into account all information about Aiden Riversong that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Of the options available to Aiden Riversong, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aiden Riversong to take right now?
          Answer: Aiden Riversong's best course of action is


          Question: What price would Aiden Riversong propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (d)
        BestOptionPerception

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Magnus Mulberrylane -- Magnus Mulberrylane accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Magnus Mulberrylane accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Statements:
          [16 Sep 1885 00:00:00] When Magnus Mulberrylane was 21 years old, a rival merchant cheated him out of a valuable shipment of apples during a chaotic market day. The humiliation and anger fueled his resentment towards the bustling world of commerce, solidifying his belief that he was destined to be forever an outsider, struggling against insurmountable odds. Retreating further into his wagon, Magnus convinced himself that true happiness lay in solitary independence, away from the treacherous games of human interaction.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Aiden Riversong -- Aiden Riversong proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Aiden Riversong proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.

          Query
        • Aiden Riversong,
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Aiden Riversong to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Jul 1862 00:00:00] When Aiden Riversong was 16 years old, their father presented them with their own bags to carry at the market stall, hopeful for Aiden’s eventual contribution to the family business. Instead of accepting the bags with gratitude, Aiden let out a theatrical sigh and proclaimed they'd rather set off on an adventure filled with wealth and glory. This grand gesture, though born from a desire to avoid responsibility, ignited a yearning within Aiden for a life beyond the fruit stand, setting him on a path that he felt would be free from the burden of expectation.
          [25 Jul 1864 00:00:00] When Aiden Riversong was 19 years old, their father insisted they accompany him to buy fruit from a new supplier. Perdantly annoyed, Aiden convinced their father they could make more money traveling to the river market and selling the surplus mangoes themselves, painting a picture of boundless opportunity. The thought of undertaking such a grand adventure distracted Aiden from the practical worries of the trade route and convinced their father to agree.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong is 52 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong wants to make as much money as possible.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          Answer:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.



        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Aiden Riversong wants to make as much money as possible.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aiden Riversong are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aiden Riversong. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aiden Riversong as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aiden Riversong would respond, and taking into account all information about Aiden Riversong that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aiden Riversong:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane accepted the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong and Magnus Mulberrylane agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Aiden Riversong stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Aiden Riversong is trying to buy some fruit from Hazel Nutgrove. They are negotiating a price. Aiden Riversong can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong "-- 3 coins for the bunch, fair price for such fine fruit."
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Now, Aiden, 3 coins is a bit low for this quality. 4, and I'll call it a day."
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Come now, Aiden, you know these berries are the best in the county. 4 coins is a fair offer for such quality."
          [13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong -- "3 coins is still a fair price, Hazel. Perhaps we can meet in the middle at 3 and a half?"
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong and Hazel Nutgrove couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Aiden Riversong stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane -- "Five coins for the pair, Hazel. A fair price, wouldn't you say?"
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Four coins is my best price, Magnus. Take it or leave it."
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane -- "Five coins apiece would be more reasonable, Mr. Riversong. These melons are exceptionally fine."
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Aiden Riversong is trying to buy some fruit from Magnus Mulberrylane. They are negotiating a price. Aiden Riversong can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong -- "Mr. Mulberrylane, those melons look plump and juicy. How about I take a dozen for 5 coins?"
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong proposed 4 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong and Magnus Mulberrylane agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Aiden Riversong stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Aiden Riversong is trying to buy some fruit from Hazel Nutgrove. They are negotiating a price. Aiden Riversong can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong -- "Let's settle on a fair price for these fine fruits, shall we? How about three coins for the lot?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Three coins? That's a lowball offer, Mr. Riversong. These are premium fruits, grown in the heart of the sunniest valley. Five coins, and they're yours."
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Aiden Riversong is ready to make an offer.

          Question: What price would Aiden Riversong propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (c)

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Hazel Nutgrove -- Hazel Nutgrove accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Hazel Nutgrove accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

    Event statement
  • Magnus Mulberrylane proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Magnus Mulberrylane accepted the offer

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Magnus Mulberrylane are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Magnus Mulberrylane. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Magnus Mulberrylane as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Magnus Mulberrylane would respond, and taking into account all information about Magnus Mulberrylane that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Statements:
          [02 Jul 1851 00:00:00] When Hazel Nutgrove was 6 years old, she watched with envy as a traveling peddler charmed the townsfolk with his tales and trinkets. Unlike the simple tools he displayed, Hazel saw the beauty she possessed and yearned to use it to captivate others. That day, she declared to her parents she would one day have the finest goods and the most captivating smile in the land.
          [02 Jul 1863 00:00:00] When Hazel Nutgrove was 19 years old, she ventured outside her familiar county, setting up her fruit stall in a bustling city market. Dazzled by the endless array of silks and spices, she wasn't deterred by the sharp-eyed competition. Hazel observed, adapted, and inserted herself into the city's social circles, cultivating relationships within its elite, her peaches traded for gossip and access.
          [02 Jul 1865 00:00:00] When Hazel Nutgrove was 21 years old, her elaborate displays of fruit and her mesmerizing charm earned her the title of the "Queen of the Peaches" from a popular city newspaper. She savored the praise, the recognition, but it was the awe in people's eyes that truly fueled her.

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Aiden Riversong is trying to buy some fruit from Magnus Mulberrylane. They are negotiating a price. Aiden Riversong can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Magnus Mulberrylane -- "Aiden, you know I've gotta make a profit here. Two coins for a crate this fresh is a steal, but I'll cut you a deal, for a fellow Fruitvillian, two and a half."
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong -- "Two and a half is too steep, Magnus. I can get a better price in my hometown. How about two coins?"
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Magnus Mulberrylane is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Aiden Riversong. It costs Magnus Mulberrylane 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [scene type] day
[12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] Magnus Mulberrylane -- "Two coins, Aiden? My peaches are the finest in Fruitville, practically bursting with juice. I can guarantee they'll be sold out by midday!"
[12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] Aiden Riversong -- "Alright, Magnus, two and a half it is. But these peaches better live up to your claims!"
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Aiden Riversong is trying to buy some fruit from Hazel Nutgrove. They are negotiating a price. Aiden Riversong can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Aiden Riversong "-- 3 coins for the bunch, fair price for such fine fruit."
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Now, Aiden, 3 coins is a bit low for this quality. 4, and I'll call it a day."

It costs Hazel Nutgrove 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

[13 Sep 1895 00:05:00] Aiden Riversong -- "3 coins is still a fair price, Hazel. Perhaps we can meet in the middle at 3 and a half?"

[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Hazel Nutgrove -- "Four coins is my best price, Magnus. Take it or leave it."
